This page uses Creative Commons Licensed content from Wikipedia (view authors).

Brave Enough is the third studio album by American electronic musician Lindsey Stirling, released independently on the imprint Lindseystomp Records on August 19, 2016. The album is composed of six instrumental tracks and eight tracks with featured vocalists, such as Christina Perri, ZZ Ward, Dan + Shay, Lecrae, and several others.

Background[]

Release and promotion[]

Singles[]

On June 28, 2016, The Arena, the first single from the album was released. The music video for The Arena debuted the same day.

On July 15, the second single, Something Wild featuring Andrew McMahon was released and the music video was released on August 3. Something Wild also features as the end credits song for the Disney film Pete's Dragon.

On August 6, the third single, Prism, which was produced by Robert DeLong, was released.

On November 16th, the fourth single, "Hold My Heart", was released.

On March 6, 2017, the fifth single, "Love's Just a Feeling" featuring Rooty was released, with the music video released the same day.

"The Arena" and "Don't Let This Feeling Fade" (featuring Rivers Cuomo and Lecrae) were used as official theme songs for the 2017 CONCACAF Gold Cup football tournament.

Tour[]

Artwork[]

Digital booklet[]

Critical reception[]

Commercial performance[]

Brave Enough debuted at number 5 on the Billboard 200 chart with 49,000 album-equivalent units (including 45,000 in traditional album sales) in its first week, earning Stirling her second top 10 album. This figure marked the largest sales week for a dance/electronic album since Stirling's previous release, Shatter Me, sold 56,000 upon release in 2014.

The album also debuted at No. 1 on the Top Classical Albums and Dance/Electronic Albums charts, her third consecutive chart-topper on each tally.

Brave Enough won the Billboard Music Award for Top Dance/Electronic Album in 2017.

Track listing[]

Stirling also sent an exclusive track titled "Firefly" to those who pre-ordered Brave Enough via PledgeMusic.
